title: Snapchat piles on users worldwide after successful Android relaunch
text:
Snapchat's daily active users have soared from 203m to 210m in the three months ending in September, buoyed by strong growth outside its core markets of Europe and North America.

The troubled photo-sharing app, known for its disappearing messages and popularity with young people, substantially beat Wall Street's expectations thanks to a successful relaunch of its Android smartphone version.

Shares in the app's parent company, Snap, fell slightly in after hours trading following news that its revenues had risen by 50pc year on year to $446m (£346m) and its net loss fallen from $255m in June to $227m today. Guidance on future revenue was a little below Wall Street's hopes, as was free cash flow. ...
description: Snapchat's daily active users have soared from 203m to 210m in the three months ending in September, buoyed by strong growth outside its core markets of Europe and North America.
